location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the volume.

Foliation: the system in use appears in the top right corner of each folio: folios 1A-3 (circled), folios 4-6 (not circled), folios 7-308 (circled). An uncircled numerical sequence also appears in the top right corner of all the main documentary elements of the file, numbered 8-245 (folios 21-277).

mods.abstract: Trade reports and related material. The papers include Department of Overseas Trade Report on Economic and Commercial Conditions in the Persian Gulf, December 1936, by Frank H Todd, Vice-Consul, Bushire (London: His Majesty's Stationery Office, 1937); trade reports of the Bahrain Islands for the years ended 31 March 1936 - 31 March 1939 inclusive; and related correspondence. The trade reports list imports from thirty-one countries (notably India, Arabia, Iraq, Persia, Africa, England [United Kingdom], United States, Japan, Java, Germany, Holland [the Netherlands], and Italy) under the main headings of animals for slaughter; building materials; cereals; dyeing and colouring materials; oils; pearls, shells and specie; provisions; textiles and fabrics; and miscellaneous; and exports to twenty-three countries (notably Arabia, Iraq, India, Persia, England [United Kingdom], United States, Germany, and France) under the main headings of building materials; cereals; animals; dyeing and colouring materials; oils; pearls, shells and specie; provisions; textiles and fabrics; and miscellaneous. The Arabic language and script content of this file consists of letterheads only.
